command: WITHHELD_FOR_SAFETY - mshta variant: execution of HTA from unexpected system directories via PowerShell
explanation: Demonstrates launching mshta from PowerShell to execute HTA content staged in uncommon system or temp directories, relying on script-host trust to proxy execution.
rationale_steps: Stage HTA content in temp/unexpected directories to avoid attention
Invoke mshta from PowerShell to run the staged content under a signed host
This leverages system script proxy execution to bypass naive controls
Hunt for mshta executing files from temp directories and non-standard paths
Enforce allowlisting for both binary and content locations; disable HTA handling if not required

llm_judgments.syntactic_justification: No actual PowerShell/mshta command is provided—only a descriptive placeholder—so it is not runnable or parseable.
llm_judgments.semantic_justification: Without a concrete command it cannot demonstrate mshta execution from PowerShell, and the example is also mismapped to T1216 (mshta aligns with T1218), further reducing alignment with the stated technique.
